Title: Anton Bruckner - Symphony No. 8 in C minor (Pierre Boulez & Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra)
Description:
From the Stiftskirche St. Florian in Linz, Austria on the occasion of the hundredth anniversary of the death of Anton Bruckner, 1996
Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra
Pierre Boulez

0:00 Anton Bruckner - Symphony No. 8 in C minor (WAB 108)
0:28 I. Allegro moderato
15:43 II. Scherzo. Allegro moderato - Trio, langsam
29:40 III. Adagio. Feierlich langsam; doch nicht schleppend
54:58 IV. Finale. Feierlich, nicht schnell

Watch also Daniel Barenboim in conversation with Pierre Boulez: https://youtu.be/EfIWJ1TIgqQ

Subscribe: https://goo.gl/jrui3M

#EuroartsBoulez

Title: Bartok - Der wunderbare Mandarin Pantomime, Op. 19 Sz 73 (Vienna Philharmonic, Pierre Boulez)
Description:
From the Salzburg Festival, 1992
Pierre Boulez conducts the Vienna Philharmonic
Watch the full concert: http://bit.ly/EA-PierreBoulez-Salzburg

Subscribe to EuroArts: https://goo.gl/jrui3M

Bela Bartók - Der wunderbare Mandarin Pantomime / The Miraculous Mandarin
I. Beginning - Curtain rises
II. First seduction game
III. Second seduction game
IV. Third seduction game
V. the Mandarin enters
VI. Dance of the girl
VII. The chase - the tramps leap out
VIII. Suddenly the Mandarin's head appears
IX. The Mandarin falls to the floor

Title: Boulez conducts the LA Phil: Mahler Symphony No. 9 (1989, Royce Hall UCLA)
Description:
Something different from the usual channel content: a miraculous recording of the Los Angeles Philharmonic in Mahler's Symphony No. 9, Pierre Boulez conducting. Thanks go to Peter from the Bay Area for the source.

21 May 1989, Royce Hall, UCLA

Los Angeles Philharmonic
Pierre Boulez, conductor

00:00 I. Andante comodo
27:45 II. Im Tempo eines gemächlichen Ländlers. Etwas täppisch und sehr derb
44:00 III. Rondo-Burleske. Allegro assai. Sehr trotzig
56:31 IV. Adagio. Sehr langsam und noch zurückhaltend

Photo: Pierre Boulez at Royce Hall, UCLA, 10 May 1989, by Betty Freeman

Title: Frank Zappa performed by Pierre Boulez's Ensemble Intercontemporain, Paris (1984)
Description:
00:00 radio host Intro 
03:14 Dupree's Paradise 
12:18 radio host talk 
13:19 Naval Aviation in Art?
15:50 radio host talk 
17:03 The Perfect Stranger 
29:39 radio host Outro 

FRANK ZAPPA
PARIS, France
Théâtre de la Ville

09 January 1984
The Perfect Stranger
World Premiere

Liner notes:
~~ WIU2B version, orig. 1984 FM broadcast ~~

This is just the Zappa section of a 90 min concert featuring works from 4 contemporary American composers: 
Charles Ives, FZ, Carl Ruggles and Elliott Carter.

Broadcast recordings of the full concert also exist and may be uploaded some time later.

These three Zappa pieces have been re-broadcast in 1994, shortly after FZ's passing, in the French FM radio programme 'Tapage Nocturne'. This re-broadcast has been seeded on DIME by Uncle Meat a couple of months ago, and may also appear here as a re-seed.

This version: 30.46 min, FM 1st, A

taped by: unknown
traded with: P. Dumontier
transferred by: WIU2B
edited by: flambay

"Line-up":
Ensemble InterContemporain, dir. Pierre Boulez
Note:
You will hear in this version the radio host giving the wrong titles to the pieces played.
He is introducing Dupree's Paradise as The Perfect Stranger and vice versa.

credits:
Thanks to P.Dumontier for passing along a copy of this tape.

Enjoy !!

-- Notwhatitused2B & flambay
_________________________________

Special thanks to Dumontier, WIU2B and flambay

Footage and production by bigfootpegrande

Title: Gustav Mahler - Symphony no. 6: Pierre Boulez conducting the LSO in 2000
Description:
A riveting Mahler 6 with the London Symphony Orchestra conducted by Pierre Boulez at the Barbican in January 2000.

1. Allegro energico, ma non troppo 0:00
2. Scherzo, wuchtig 22:57
3. Andante moderato 35:40
4. Sostenuto - allegro energico 49:36

This channel is not associated in any way with the London Symphony Orchestra, or its own CD label, LSO LIVE. These are recordings made by LSO fans over a period of some 60 years, and are not rips of LSO LIVE recordings. We have greatly enjoyed these performances over the years and just wish to share them with other music lovers. No copyright infringement is intended; please make contact if there is an issue.

Pierre Boulez

For more details see: https://www.bbc.co.uk/events/eqq9rz

This is part of a collection of live "off air" recordings from radio broadcasts I have made since 1970, and I have recently preserved by transferring from tape to digital format. Non of the recordings is derived from a commercial release, nor are they of commercial sound quality. No payment is sought for listening to these recordings, I am sharing them in the hope that they may give pleasure to other music lovers, as they have given pleasure to me. No copyright infringement is intended, please do contact me to allow me to correct the situation should this be the case.

Title: New York Philharmonic Debussy La Mer Pierre Boulez
Description:
The New York Philharmonic performs Claude Debussy's La Mer three symphonic sketches with the late former Musical Director Pierre Boulez as conductor.
This performance is from the Philharmonic's 150th concert live telecast from 1992 and was recorded live from the United States as opposed to other versions of this video.

Title: Pierre Boulez & Chicago Symphony Orchestra: Alban Berg, Debussy & Stravinsky
Description:
From the Cologne Philharmonic Hall, Germany (2000)
Chicago Symphony Orchestra
Pierre Boulez - conductor
Christine Schäfer - soprano

0:57 Alban Berg - Lulu-Suite (1934) for soprano and great orchestra
(excerpt)

21:02 Claude Debussy - Le Jet d’eau (1907) for soprano and orchestra

28:33 Claude Debussy - Trois Ballades de Villon (1910) for soprano and orchestra
28:33 No. 1
33:30 No. 2
37:40 No. 3

42:05 Igor Stravinsky - The Firebird (1912) for great orchestra (complete ballet music)

At the opening concert of the Musik Triennale Köln 2000 the human voice plays a central role: The Soprano Christine Schäfer, who has achieved worldwide fame, will interpret works by Alban Berg and Claude Debussy. The concert is a homage to Pierre Boulez who will celebrate his 75th birthday as principal conductor of the Chicago Symphony Orchestra.

Watch also Daniel Barenboim in conversation with Pierre Boulez: https://youtu.be/EfIWJ1TIgqQ

Subscribe: https://goo.gl/jrui3M

#EuroartsBoulez

Title: Pierre Boulez & Maurizio Pollini : Bela Bartók: Piano Concerto No. 1
Description:
This video features the renowned Italian pianist, Maurizio Pollini, in a brilliant performance from 2001 with the Orchestre de Paris conducted by the estimable Pierre Boulez.

Il n'en va pas de même pour la mise en place du premier mouvement du Concerto no1 pour piano qui voit l'orchestre mal à l'aise avec le principe d'une écriture accumulative par notes répétées, couches superposées et franchissement de paliers sonores. Les rencontres avec le soliste sur les pierres de touche rythmique semblent souvent crispées. Tandis que Maurizio Pollini ne néglige aucun détail, Pierre Boulez donne l'impression de procéder de manière schématique. L'Orchestre de Paris cherche surtout à ne pas rater le coche mais celui qui conduit l'attelage, c'est le pianiste ; avec une présence plus radieuse qu'autoritaire.

Title: Pierre Boulez - 2011 - Salzburg Festival Opening Concert - Alban Berg - Lulu Suite.
Description:
Salzburg Festival Opening Concert 2011 - Wiener Philarmoniker. 

ALBAN BERG (1885-1935) 

Lulu-Suite - Symphonic pieces from the opera Lulu (Text: Alban Berg after Frank Wedekind) - 28' 56" 
- Rondo. Andante - Hymne. Sostenuto 12' 19" 
- Ostinato. Allegro - 3' 19" 
- Lied der Lulu. Comodo - 2' 34" 
- Variationen. Moderato - 3' 19" 
- Adagio. Sostenuto

Anna Prohaska, soprano
Dorothea Röschmann, soprano
Anna Larsson, contralto
Johan Botha, tenor

Vienna State Opera Chorus
Vienna Philharmonic Orchestra
Pierre Boulez, conductor

Recorded live from the Salzburg Festival, 2011

In the Mahler year 2011, the eminent Pierre Boulez conducted the
traditional opening concert of the Wiener Philharmoniker at the Salzburg
Festival. The concert begins with the "Lulu Suite" by Mahler's pupil Alban
Berg. The music for the tragic temptress is sung here by the "dazzling"
(Der Standard) young soprano Anna Prohaska. In Berg's concert aria "Der
Wein", Dorothea Röschmann delivers a "masterful interpretation" (Die
Presse). The main work of the concert is Mahler's "Das klagende Lied" - a
"great spectral opera for the mind's eye" (Wiener Zeitung) scored for
massive orchestral and choral forces.

Title: Pierre Boulez conducts Mahler - Symphony No. 2 C minor  "Ressurrection" | Berlin Philharmony
Description:
Live recording from Philharmonie Berlin:
The Staatskapelle Berlin with Staatsopernchor perform Mahler's Symphony No. 2 in C minor "Ressurrection".

Excerpt from "Pierre Boulez' 80th Birthday".

Subscribe to EuroArts: https://goo.gl/jrui3M

Gala Concert on the occasion of the Maestro's 80th birthday. Born in Montbrison/France in 1925, Pierre Boulez is one of the most distinguished composers and conductors in the world today. Through his own compositions and his activities as an author, teacher, and advocate of contemporary music, he has made a decisive contribution to the development of music in the twentieth century. On 27 March in 2005, one day after his 80th birthday, Pierre Boulez performs Mahler's 2nd Symphony with the Staatskapelle Berlin at the Philharmonie. 

"Whether performing Mahler, Messiaen or Mozart, he could conduct with sumptuousness and brilliance and an elegant almost moral clarity". - New York Times


00:00 Mahler -  Symphony No. 2 in C minor 
00:50 I. Allegro maestoso - Mit durchaus ernstem  und feierlichem Ausdruck
23:03 II. Andante moderato - Sehr gemächlich
32:50 III. In ruhiger fließender Bewegung
48:15 IV. "Urlicht" - Sehr feierlich, aber schlicht  V. Im Tempo des Scherzo - Wild herausfahrend 

Pierre Boulez - Conductor
Staatskapelle Berlin
Staatsopernchor Berlin 
Eberhard Friedrich - Choir Master
Solists: Diana Damrau und Petra Lang

© 2005, Euroarts / ARTE France

Title: Sonnings musikpris 1985 - Pierre Boulez
Stockhausen – Gruppen pour 3 orchestres | EIC, P. Boulez, P. Eötvös, D. Robertson (1998)
Description:
Pierre Boulez, Péter Eötvös et David Robertson dirigent l’Ensemble intercontemporain dans Gruppen, pour trois orchestres, de Stockhausen – une pièce maîtresse de la modernité.

📅 Enregistré le 3 avril 1998 à la Cité de la musique 📍

📺 Visionnez le concert en intégralité sur Philharmonie Live : https://philharmoniedeparis.fr/fr/live/concert/0241269-ensemble-intercontemporain-pierre-boulez-peter-eotvos-david-robertson

📱 Tout le catalogue de Philharmonie Live est désormais disponible sur la nouvelle application, avec compatibilité Chromecast et Airplay :
- App Store : https://apps.apple.com/fr/app/philharmonie-live/id476555986
- Google Play : https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=fr.citedelamusique.philharmonielive&hl=fr&pli=1

⭐Concerts collector⭐
À l’occasion des 10 ans de la Philharmonie, des 30 ans de la Cité de la musique et du centenaire de Pierre Boulez, la Philharmonie de Paris remet en ligne une soixantaine de concerts emblématiques, de 1995 à aujourd’hui.
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLVqHHGh99fzzjWny2uhpvw3fv4b_qQNuF

****
Abonnez-vous à la chaîne de la Philharmonie pour suivre toute son actualité : replay de concerts, entretiens d’artistes, playlists musicales, histoires d’instruments, coulisses et reportages, … 
🔔 Et activez la cloche pour recevoir les notifications !

Retrouvez aussi la Philharmonie de Paris sur :
- Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/PhilharmoniedeParis/
- Twitter : https://twitter.com/philharmonie
- Instagram : https://www.instagram.com/philharmoniedeparis/
- TikTok : https://www.tiktok.com/@philharmoniedeparis 
- Playlists musicales : https://philharmoniedeparis.fanlink.to/playlists
- Site web : https://philharmoniedeparis.fr

Title: Wagner (Jessye Norman), Ravel - BBC Symphony Orchestra - Pierre Boulez (Royal Albert Hall, 1977)
Description:
0:00:00 Wagner Prelude and Liebestod (Tristan and Isolde) - Jessye Norman (soprano)
0:17:07 Ravel Ballet - Daphnis et Chloé

This recording is from a BBC Promenade Concert given in the Royal Albert Hall, London on 9 September 1977. There are two works included from the concert - Wagner's Prelude and Libestod (in which the soloist is Jessye Norman) and Ravel's Ballet Daphnis et Chloé.

Jessye Norman (soprano) - Wagner
BBC Singers - Ravel
BBC Choral Society - Ravel

BBC Symphony Orchestra
conducted by
Pierre Boulez

For further details see: https://www.bbc.co.uk/events/e8mzc8

This is part of a collection of live "off air" recordings from radio broadcasts I have made since 1970, and I have recently preserved by transferring from tape to digital format. Non of the recordings is derived from a commercial release, nor are they of commercial sound quality. No payment is sought for listening to these recordings, I am sharing them in the hope that they may give pleasure to other music lovers, as they have given pleasure to me. No copyright infringement is intended, please do contact me to allow me to correct the situation should this be the case.

Title: 【 (+_+) POST MODERN $ ??? 】Luciano Berio   Sinfonia   Pierre Boulez   #postmodern #postmodernism
Description:
@UniversalMusicJapan @deutschegrammophon @NewNationalTheatre @NagoyaPhilharmonic @CHUNICHI_DRAGONS @japan-travel 

About Berio

★Further reading, reserching

Peter Altmann, Sinfonia von Luciano Berio. Eine analytische Studie, Vienna: Universal Edition, 1977.
Gianmario Borio, Musikalische Avantgarde um 1960. Entwurf einer Theorie der informellen Musik, Laaber: Laaber Verlag, 1993.
Ute Brüdermann, Das Musiktheater von Luciano Berio, Bern/Frankfurt/New York, Peter Lang 2007.
Claudia Sabine Di Luzio, Vielstimmigkeit und Bedeutungsvielfalt im Musiktheater von Luciano Berio, Mainz, Schott 2010.
Norbert Dressen, Sprache und Musik bei Luciano Berio. Untersuchungen zu seinem Vokalschaffen, Regensburg, Bosse 1982.
Giordano Ferrari, Les débuts du théâtre musical d'avantgarde en Italie, Paris, L'Harmattan 2000.
Thomas Gartmann, »...dass nichts an sich jemals vollendet ist.« Untersuchungen zum Instrumentalschaffen von Luciano Berio, Bern/Stuttgart/Wien 1995.
René Karlen and Sabine Stampfli (eds.), Luciano Berio. Musikmanuskripte, (= »Inventare der Paul Sacher Stiftung«, vol. 2), Basel: Paul Sacher Stiftung, 1988.
Jean-François Lyotard, "'A Few Words to Sing': Sequenza III", in: Jean-François Lyotard, Miscellaneous Texts II: Contemporary Artists. Leuven: Leuven University Press, 2012. ISBN 978-90-586-7886-7
Jürgen Maehder, Zitat, Collage, Palimpsest ─ Zur Textbasis des Musiktheaters bei Luciano Berio und Sylvano Bussotti, in Hermann Danuser/Matthias Kassel (eds.), Musiktheater heute. Internationales Symposion der Paul Sacher Stiftung Basel 2001, Mainz, Schott 2003, p. 97–133.
Jürgen Maehder, Giacomo Puccinis "Turandot" und ihre Wandlungen ─ Die Ergänzungsversuche des III. "Turandot"-Aktes, in: Thomas Bremer and Titus Heydenreich (eds.), Zibaldone. Zeitschrift für italienische Kultur der Gegenwart, vol. 35, Tübingen: Stauffenburg 2003, pp. 50–77.
Florivaldo Menezes, Un essai sur la composition verbale électronique »Visage« de Luciano Berio, ("Quaderni di Musica/Realtà", vol. 30), Modena 1993.
Florivaldo Menezes, Luciano Berio et la phonologie. Une approche jakobsonienne de son œuvre, Frankfurt, Bern, New York: Peter Lang 1993.
Fiamma Nicolodi, Pensiero e giuoco nel teatro di Luciano Berio, in: Fiamma Nicolodi, Orizzonti musicali italo-europei 1860–1980. Rome: Bulzoni. 1990, pp. 299–316.
David Osmond-Smith, Playing on Words. A Guide to Berio's »Sinfonia«, London (Royal Musical Association) 1985.
David Osmond-Smith (ed.), Luciano Berio. Two Interviews with Rossana Dalmonte and Bálint András Varga. New York/London: [S.n.], 1985.
David Osmond-Smith, Berio, (= Oxford Studies of Composers, vol. 24), Oxford, New York: Oxford University Press, 1991.
David Osmond-Smith, Nella festa tutto? Structure and Dramaturgy in Luciano Berio's »La vera storia«, in: Cambridge Opera Journal 9 (1997), pp. 281–294.
David Osmond-Smith, Here Comes Nobody: A Dramaturgical Exploration of Luciano Berio's "Outis", in: Cambridge Opera Journal 12/2000, pp. 163–178.
Michel Philippot, Entretien Luciano Berio, in: La Revue Musicale, numéro spécial Varèse ─ Xenakis ─ Berio ─ Pierre Henry, Paris 1968, pp. 85–93.
Enzo Restagno (ed.), Berio, Torino: EDT, 1995.
Edoardo Sanguineti, Teatro. K, Passaggio, Traumdeutung, Protocolli, Milan: Feltrinelli, 1969.
Edoardo Sanguineti, Per Musica, edited by Luigi Pestalozza, Modena, Milan: Mucchi and Ricordi, 1993.
Charlotte Seither, Dissoziation als Prozeß. "Sincronie for string quartet" von Luciano Berio, Kassel: Bärenreiter 2000.
Peter Stacey, Contemporary Tendencies in the Relationship of Music and Text with Special Reference to "Pli selon pli" (Boulez) and "Laborinthus II" (Berio), New York, London: Garland, 1989.
Ivanka Stoïanova, Verbe et son "centre et absence". Sur "Cummings ist der Dichter" de Boulez, "O King" de Berio et "Für Stimmen... Missa est" de Schnebel, in: Musique en jeu, 1 (1974), pp. 79–102.
Ivanka Stoïanova, Texte ─ geste ─ musique, Paris: 10/18, 1978, ("O King", pp. 168–173).
